rev.comment: Rm fair use covers in discography, per [[WP:NFC]]

Line 3: Line 3:
==Home video releases==
==Home video releases==
===Howard Stern's NegligeÃ© and Underpants Party===
===Howard Stern's NegligeÃ© and Underpants Party===
â
[[File:howard stern underpants party 1988 vhs cover.jpg|thumb|right|115px|VHS cover]]
  â  
'''''Howard Stern's NegligeÃ© and Underpants Party''''' <ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1346994/</ref> was the first pay-per-view special hosted by [[Howard Stern]], airing on February 27, 1988 in [[New York City]] and costing $19.95. Filmed live in front of a studio audience, all stripped to their [[underpants]] and [[lingerie]]. Stern and [[The Howard Stern Show staff|his radio show staff]] led viewers through a series of provocative antics, including "Lesbian Dial-a-Date", goading a male audience member to tongue-kiss transvestite [[Siobhan Meow]] (a member of the show's [[The Wack Pack|Wack Pack]]), a [[homeless]] man makeover and a man lighting his crotch on fire. On March 7, 1988 the event was released on [[VHS]] via [[mail order]] for $24.95.
'''''Howard Stern's NegligeÃ© and Underpants Party''''' <ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1346994/</ref> was the first pay-per-view special hosted by [[Howard Stern]], airing on February 27, 1988 in [[New York City]] and costing $19.95. Filmed live in front of a studio audience, all stripped to their [[underpants]] and [[lingerie]]. Stern and [[The Howard Stern Show staff|his radio show staff]] led viewers through a series of provocative antics, including "Lesbian Dial-a-Date", goading a male audience member to tongue-kiss transvestite [[Siobhan Meow]] (a member of the show's [[The Wack Pack|Wack Pack]]), a [[homeless]] man makeover and a man lighting his crotch on fire. On March 7, 1988 the event was released on [[VHS]] via [[mail order]] for $24.95.
Line 30: Line 28:
===Howard Stern's U.S. Open Sores===
===Howard Stern's U.S. Open Sores===
â
[[File:howard stern us open sores ppv special front.jpg|right|thumb|115px|VHS cover]]
  â  
'''''Howard Stern's U.S. Open Sores''''' was an event that occurred at the [[Nassau Coliseum]], [[Uniondale, New York|Uniondale]], [[New York]] in front of a sold-out attendance of 16,000. Taking place on October 7, 1989, the [[main event]] featured a [[tennis]] match between [[Howard Stern]] and [[The Howard Stern Show|his radio show]] producer [[Gary Dell'Abate]]. The event sold out in four hours, with each ticket costing $22.50. Other suggested event titles included ''The Bush Open'', ''U.S. Open Legs'', ''U.S. Open Beaver'' and ''U.S. Beaver Open''. The event was later released on [[VHS]] via [[mail order]]. A documentary crew shot behind-the-scenes footage including interviews with participants and guests creating a 105-minute program.
'''''Howard Stern's U.S. Open Sores''''' was an event that occurred at the [[Nassau Coliseum]], [[Uniondale, New York|Uniondale]], [[New York]] in front of a sold-out attendance of 16,000. Taking place on October 7, 1989, the [[main event]] featured a [[tennis]] match between [[Howard Stern]] and [[The Howard Stern Show|his radio show]] producer [[Gary Dell'Abate]]. The event sold out in four hours, with each ticket costing $22.50. Other suggested event titles included ''The Bush Open'', ''U.S. Open Legs'', ''U.S. Open Beaver'' and ''U.S. Beaver Open''. The event was later released on [[VHS]] via [[mail order]]. A documentary crew shot behind-the-scenes footage including interviews with participants and guests creating a 105-minute program.
Line 53: Line 49:
===Butt Bongo Fiesta===
===Butt Bongo Fiesta===
â
[[File:howard stern butt bongo fiesta 1992 front.jpg|right|thumb|115px|VHS cover]]
  â  
'''''Butt Bongo Fiesta''''' is a [[VHS]] of a special hosted by Howard Stern. Released in late 1992, the tape features "Jungle Man," a segment filmed for [[3-D film|3-D]] viewing, with each original tape being supplied with two 3-D viewing glasses.
'''''Butt Bongo Fiesta''''' is a [[VHS]] of a special hosted by Howard Stern. Released in late 1992, the tape features "Jungle Man," a segment filmed for [[3-D film|3-D]] viewing, with each original tape being supplied with two 3-D viewing glasses.
Line 76: Line 70:
===The Miss Howard Stern New Year's Eve Pageant===
===The Miss Howard Stern New Year's Eve Pageant===
â
[[File:howard stern new years rotten eve vhs front.jpg|right|thumb|115px|VHS cover]]
  â  
'''''The Miss Howard Stern New Year's Eve Pageant''''' (later released as '''''Howard Stern's New Year's Rotten Eve 1994''''') was a two-hour [[pay-per-view]] special that aired on [[New Year's Eve]] [[1993]] and [[New Year's Day]] [[1994]], hosted by [[Howard Stern]]. Included in the special were parodies of [[Michael Jackson]] and [[Jerry Seinfeld]], a song by [[Gary Dell'Abate]] ([[The Howard Stern Show|Stern's radio show]] Executive Producer) called "Doing the Baba Booey," and a mock [[beauty pageant]] resulting in the crowning of the show's first "[[Miss Howard Stern]]." Judges for the pageant included [[Janis Ian]], [[The Wack Pack#Daniel Carver|Daniel Carver]], [[John Bobbitt]], [[Sherman Hemsley]], [[Mark Hamill]], [[Tiny Tim (musician)|Tiny Tim]] and [[Joe Frazier]].
'''''The Miss Howard Stern New Year's Eve Pageant''''' (later released as '''''Howard Stern's New Year's Rotten Eve 1994''''') was a two-hour [[pay-per-view]] special that aired on [[New Year's Eve]] [[1993]] and [[New Year's Day]] [[1994]], hosted by [[Howard Stern]]. Included in the special were parodies of [[Michael Jackson]] and [[Jerry Seinfeld]], a song by [[Gary Dell'Abate]] ([[The Howard Stern Show|Stern's radio show]] Executive Producer) called "Doing the Baba Booey," and a mock [[beauty pageant]] resulting in the crowning of the show's first "[[Miss Howard Stern]]." Judges for the pageant included [[Janis Ian]], [[The Wack Pack#Daniel Carver|Daniel Carver]], [[John Bobbitt]], [[Sherman Hemsley]], [[Mark Hamill]], [[Tiny Tim (musician)|Tiny Tim]] and [[Joe Frazier]].
